name: SortableList
note: We've seen a case where not all items are rendered on some Android devices, this appears to be a bug with `FlatList` that is using `CellRendererComponent`, our current workaround is for you to add `initialNumToRender={data.length}`.

props.name: data
props.description: The data of the list, with an id prop as unique identifier.
props.note: Do not update 'data' in 'onOrderChange' (i.e. for each order change); only update it when you change the items (i.g. adding and removing an item).

props.name: onOrderChange
props.description: A callback to get the new order (or swapped items) and info about the change (from and to indices).

props.name: enableHaptic
props.description:
Whether to enable the haptic feedback.
(please note that react-native-haptic-feedback does not support the specific haptic type on Android starting on an unknown version, you can use 1.8.2 for it to work properly)

props.name: itemProps
props.type: {margins?: {marginTop?: number; marginBottom?: number; marginLeft?: number; marginRight?: number}}

props.name: flexMigration
props.description: A temporary migration flag for enabling flex on the list's container (like it should be by default)

hero.title: SortableList
hero.description:
Draggable List is a behavior of a list which allows re-arrangement
of its items.  The drag-and-drop functionality is a preferred method of organization for most users. It’s more organic with the gesture controls of mobile and intuitive. Drag-and-drop provides a level of direct manipulation that other methods can’t match.
Draggable list is less appropriate in long lists with scrolling.
